title: Sidewall, 1850–1930
provenance: Eleven fragments of wallpapers from "Craigflowers" farmhouse, occupied 1856 Victoria, British Columbia.
description: a) Yellow ground, geometric white, red, black leaf configurations; b) Ceiling: white mica; c) Orange and purple pansies and lace; layer 1c pin dots, green, pink and white flowers; d) Cream leaves, blue lines, dottings;e) Light brown paper speckled with blue, red and with mortar lines, like stone laid in ashlar pattern; f) Small scale yellow and red curlicues and flowers; g) Layers including a,c, and others; h) Border with pink roses, maroon flocking, blue lines, sidewall paper of blue trailing roses on white; j) Blue diamond diaper trellis on gray, maroon petals in centers; k) Wood grain; l) Border, English architecture.
